titleStmt.title: Piety the best rule of orthodoxy, or, An essay upon this proposition, that the conduciveness of doctrines to holiness or vice is the best rule for private Christians to judge the truth or falshood of them by in a letter to his honoured friend H.M. / by Hen. Hesketh.
titleStmt.author: Hesketh, Henry, 1637?-1710.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
